channel.title: HMTL Help
channel.description:
I was wondering how I could create a textbox that would convert any code inputted when submitted into parsed HTML code. Like:
If I had a textbox like this:
[code] Embed your video here! [/code]
and I put in a youtube embed code:
[code] <object width="560" height="340"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/noXiuN3M_O0&hl=en&fs=1&"></param><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"></param><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"></param><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/noXiuN3M_O0&hl=en&fs=1&" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowscriptaccess="always" allowfullscreen="true" width="560" height="340"></embed></object> [/code]
and when I press submit, it will add the new 'post' to the directory, and when others click on the post link, they open it up and there is a youtube video playing.
Anyone have an idea of how to create this?
THANKS A BUNCH IN ADVANCE :)

item.title: HMTL Help
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

This would be used in a PHP post function.

Read full topic

i think he wants a textbox where he enters html and clicks submit it will display in page?

item.title: HMTL Help
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

So you asking how to enable tags in a submission box that will alternatively be posted onto the site from the contributing user?..

Read full topic

item.title: HMTL Help
item.dc:creator: @fatwallet fatwallet
item.description:
@fatwallet wrote:

No. I want to find out how I can have a textbox that, when a person enters some html code and presses “submit”, it will display on the page it’s posted on as parsed HTML.

So if you entered:

sample html

And pressed submit, It would look like this:

[size=16pt]sample html[/size]

Read full topic

item.title: HMTL Help
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

So you want to create an archive that users can contribute to?

Read full topic
